original_solution_mapping.L1: When Joanna purchased 4 times the number of gumballs she initially had, she added 40*4 = <<4*40=160>>160 gumballs to her dish.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The total number of gumballs Joanna had in her dish after buying 160 more is 160+40 = <<160+40=200>>200
original_solution_mapping.L3: At the same time, Jacques bought 60*4 = <<60*4=240>>240 new gumballs.
original_solution_mapping.L4: When Jacques added his new 240 gumballs to his dish, the total number of gumballs increased to 240+60 = <<240+60=300>>300 gumballs.
original_solution_mapping.L5: When they decided to put together their gumballs, they had 300+200 = <<300+200=500>>500 gumballs altogether.
original_solution_mapping.L6: After sharing equally, each person got 500/2 = <<500/2=250>>250 gumballs.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1362.
    Returns: the number of gumballs each person received after sharing equally.
    """
    # L1
    joanna_initial_gumballs = 40 # 40 and 60 gumballs, respectively
    purchase_multiplier = 4 # purchased 4 times the number
    joanna_added_gumballs = joanna_initial_gumballs * purchase_multiplier

    # L2
    joanna_total_gumballs = joanna_added_gumballs + joanna_initial_gumballs

    # L3
    jacques_initial_gumballs = 60 # 40 and 60 gumballs, respectively
    jacques_added_gumballs = jacques_initial_gumballs * purchase_multiplier

    # L4
    jacques_total_gumballs = jacques_added_gumballs + jacques_initial_gumballs

    # L5
    total_gumballs_combined = jacques_total_gumballs + joanna_total_gumballs

    # L6
    number_of_people = 2 # shared them equally
    gumballs_per_person = total_gumballs_combined / number_of_people

    # FA
    answer = gumballs_per_person
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: When Joanna purchased {purchase_multiplier} times the number of gumballs she initially had, she added {joanna_initial_gumballs}*{purchase_multiplier} = <<{purchase_multiplier}*{joanna_initial_gumballs}={joanna_added_gumballs}>>{joanna_added_gumballs} gumballs to her dish.

The total number of gumballs Joanna had in her dish after buying {joanna_added_gumballs} more is {joanna_added_gumballs}+{joanna_initial_gumballs} = <<{joanna_added_gumballs}+{joanna_initial_gumballs}={joanna_total_gumballs}>>{joanna_total_gumballs}
At the same time, Jacques bought {jacques_initial_gumballs}*{purchase_multiplier} = <<{jacques_initial_gumballs}*{purchase_multiplier}={jacques_added_gumballs}>>{jacques_added_gumballs} new gumballs.

When Jacques added his new {jacques_added_gumballs} gumballs to his dish, the total number of gumballs increased to {jacques_added_gumballs}+{jacques_initial_gumballs} = <<{jacques_added_gumballs}+{jacques_initial_gumballs}={jacques_total_gumballs}>>{jacques_total_gumballs} gumballs.

When they decided to put together their gumballs, they had {jacques_total_gumballs}+{joanna_total_gumballs} = <<{jacques_total_gumballs}+{joanna_total_gumballs}={total_gumballs_combined}>>{total_gumballs_combined} gumballs altogether.
After sharing equally, each person got {total_gumballs_combined}/{number_of_people} = <<{total_gumballs_combined}/{number_of_people}={gumballs_per_person}>>{gumballs_per_person} gumballs.
